meanings.definition: The act of placing someone back into an institution.
meanings.sent1: After his behavior worsened, the reinstitutionalizations of the patient was necessary.
meanings.sent2: The reinstitutionalizations of the elderly man into the nursing home brought mixed emotions to his family.
meanings.sent3: The reinstitutionalizations of the troublemaker led to a quieter neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: Her reinstitutionalizations into the strict boarding school felt like a return to prison.
meanings.sent5: The reinstitutionalizations of the stray animals into the shelter saved many lives.

meanings.definition: The process of reestablishing an institution.
meanings.sent1: The reinstitutionalizations of the library after the fire took months of hard work.
meanings.sent2: The government's reinstitutionalizations of the public services improved efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The reinstitutionalizations of the old factory turned it into a modern workspace.
meanings.sent4: The reinstitutionalizations of the school system aimed to enhance education quality.
meanings.sent5: The reinstitutionalizations of the historic building preserved its cultural significance.
